Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Distinctin-Like-Peptide-PH (DLP-PH; natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; UCLL1a )

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 47.2% similarity toDistinctin.Activity: Active against bacteria mainly Gram- E. coli (MIC 32 ug/mL), P. aeruginosa (MIC 64 ug/mL) and fungi C. albicans (MIC 64 ug/mL). Also inhibits proliferation of cancer cell lines such as H157, and PC3, but with little toxicity against normal human cell, HMEC-1.Predicted to be helical. The active region is located at the N-terminus of the peptide. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Wu D, Gao Y, Tan Y, Liu Y, Wang L, Zhou M, Xi X, Ma C, Bininda-Emonds ORP, Chen T, Shaw C.2018
Literature Information.Title: Discovery of Distinctin-Like-Peptide-PH (DLP-PH) From the Skin Secretion of Phyllomedusa hypochondrialis, a Prototype of a Novel Family of Antimicrobial Peptide
